file_content.text: Everybody hold on...
Hi. The Emperor and his kazillion ships'll be here any second, so we should probably go.
Eternal Fleet incoming! Come on, punch it!
Tell me, Brother--your silence this time, is it doubt or certainty?
You let Admiral Ranken die. So our own people are expendable now, is that it?
So it's the world you know versus Zakuul. Is that about right?
I want a reason. Why did you let Senator Cordan die?
Least trustworthy, sorry.
The Republic's still my foe.
I hoped all of them would make it. But we've given the survivors a reason to trust us--something they didn't have before.
We need the others' trust.
I'm forever grateful.
You faced many challenges in our rescue. I won't forget that.
Even tried knocking, see if anyone's home. It's weird. Been unresponsive ever since we lost power.
So, the Gravestone went all kinds of haywire, and now this. No response, nothing. Maybe she got hit with a power surge...
I thought you fixed the Gravestone.
Hey, this wasn't on me. Tora ran a systems check. Last event the Gravestone logged was an incoming transmission--from the Eternal Fleet ship.
I needed you to believe I was deactivated.
I take you in, and you stab me in the back.
You betrayed me.
We had an arrangement. You wanted something, I wanted something...
The Empire of Zakuul is now mine to control.
The only way to defeat Arcann is if we all work together. I have to show that I won't put the needs of the Empire above anyone else.
We need the others' trust.
We've all suffered in this war. But we can't turn on each other--Arcann's the one we should blame!
Admiral Ranken would have been a tremendous asset. You do realize that, don't you?
Least trustworthy, sorry.
The Empire's still my foe.
I hoped there'd be time for everyone to get away safely. I'm sorry.
I wanted to save them all.
I wasn't about to put a celebrity ahead of a seasoned officer and a member of the Galactic Senate.
She was just a performer.
She was exiled because she had countless fans who would listen to whatever she had to say.
We need the others' trust.
It would have been ideal to save all of them. The one I trusted the least had to go last.
The old paradigm is gone.
We can't look at the Empire and Republic as sides to take. That way of thinking will only get us killed.
Having to work with the enemy doesn't mean they aren't still my enemy.
The Republic is still my foe.
Oh, I see. So, you and I, that's just "working with the enemy."
In that case, I'll be sure to never turn my back to you.
See, that's what I love about us. The mutual respect.
That's really comforting.
Are you questioning my judgment?
Remember who's in charge here.
As if you'd ever let any of us forget.
I thank the stars for you.
Whatever you need, just say the word. I'll make it happen.
I'm sorry Malita didn't make it. She was a good person.
Rescuing us was no simple task. Your efforts will not be forgotten.
Your fellow Zakuulan... she was courageous. She won't be forgotten.
I'm grateful for the rescue. Say the word and I'll reach out to my people.
Great answer. How constructive!
Commander. You'll want to have a look at this.
Hey, Commander! You better come see this!
Did you figure out what happened to the power?
I have a theory. You're going to hate it.
Someone communicated with the Gravestone right before all the craziness. I think it was a reset command. Came from the Eternal Fleet ship.
SCORPIO. You were behind this. You gave the captain free will, shut down the Gravestone.
It was you.
That, and more. Complications along the way necessitated a great deal of maneuvering. Improvisation was the key.
Did you... install yourself onto the throne?
How are you there?
Through the frequency, yes. I wasn't certain what the outcome would be, but in the end I was able to see my plan to fruition.
All of you played vital roles as well. You were magnificent. And now I have what I've been after--command of the Eternal Fleet.
I happened to get what I wanted first--command of the Eternal Fleet.
I was trying to save everybody. But there wasn't time to discuss it. I had to make a choice.
I didn't want her to die.
Remember who's in charge of this Alliance.
Don't question my orders.
If you were calling the shots, it would be the Republic shuttle that didn't make it. You look out for your friends before your enemies.
The Imperials were expendable.
If you were calling the shots, Malita's shuttle would have been first out, and my people might be dead. You can't blame me for something you would have done yourself!
You would have done the same.
I understand your anger, Senya. But we've all sacrificed for this war. Just remember that Arcann is the one truly responsible for their deaths.
There wasn't time to discuss it. I had to make a choice. But I didn't want them to die. You know that.
I tried to save them all.
We've all sacrificed for our cause. But we mustn't forget that Arcann is the one responsible for our losses.
It seems the ships outside this sector are no longer responding to your orders. This is an interesting development.
This changes nothing. We can worry about the Eternal Fleet after we deal with Father and the Outlander.
Whatever you desire, Brother. You're the Emperor.
Commander. You'll want to have a look at this.
